instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00292: What is 820-00292? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00292</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power
threads.message:
Hi,
this board with no power, no led, clean, I found a big coil (seems <SIGNAL>PP1V0_S5</SIGNAL> is short), I can't find what component is bad.
I inject 1v 3A, nothing become hot. how can I do to find without something hot?
thanks
Best regards

[URL='https://www.dropbox.com/s/c2vmodg30ou7mb8/<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL>.jpg?dl=0']Board with inductance remove[/URL]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00292</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> is short too, I think it's <CHIP>U1100</CHIP> is damaged. don't waste more time?
thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00292</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power
threads.message:
When you find short on two power rails which have PCH as common point; very likely PCH is fried.
More easy to heat something injecting voltage on the 3V power rail...
